<PLDatabaseMigrationDelegate> Protocol Reference

The PLDatabaseMigrationDelegate is responsible for applying any migration necessary to update a database to the latest schema/data required by an application. More...

#import <PLDatabaseMigrationDelegate.h>

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

(BOOL) - migrateDatabase:currentVersion:newVersion:error:
 Called by the PLDatabaseMigrationManager to perform migrations.

Detailed Description

The PLDatabaseMigrationDelegate is responsible for applying any migration necessary to update a database to the latest schema/data required by an application.

Thread Safety
PLDatabaseMigrationDelegate instances are not required to implement any locking and must not be shared between threads.

Member Function Documentation

- (BOOL) migrateDatabase: (id< PLDatabase >)  database
currentVersion: (int)  currentVersion
newVersion: (int *)  newVersion
error: (NSError **)  outError 

Called by the PLDatabaseMigrationManager to perform migrations.

A transaction will be opened prior to this method being called. The transaction will be committed upon the return of a success value (YES). If this method returns NO, the entire transaction will be aborted, and no changes made to the database.

Parameters:
database The database to modify.
currentVersion The current version of the database. This always defaults to 0 in an uninitialized database.
newVersion Must be used to supply the new version of the database (or the current version, if nothing has changed).
outError A pointer to an NSError object variable. If an error occurs, this pointer will contain an error object indicating why the migration could not be completed. If no error occurs, this parameter will be left unmodified. You may specify NULL for this parameter, and no error information will be provided.
